result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph J Bickford

defendant.name: Bickford, Joseph J
defendant.address: 703 Odanah Street PO Box 1005, Lac du Flambeau, WA 54538

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: No contact with the victim (I.J.), no going on 931 Elks Point; Apt 403, Lac du Flambeau, Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises.

1:05 PM Defendant Joseph J Bickford appeared by video, in custody from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim appearing via zoom audio. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint. Court reads charges. Attorney rights given. State speaks to bond. States all open cases are in front of Judge Bayne-Allison. Attorney Richard Bender is appearing specially for the defendant. Court orders $5,000 CASH with conditions: No contact with the victim (I.J.), no going on 931 Elks Point; Apt 403, Lac du Flambeau, Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises. Bond form.
Initial appearance scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.
